indications:
Indications postoperative urinary retention (see
notes above), neurogenic bladder; myasthenia gravis (section 10.2.1)
name: DISTIGMINE BROMIDE
cautions:
Cautions peptic ulcer; conditions where increased motility of the urinary or gastro-intestinal
tract could be harmful; oesophagitis; cardiovascular
disease; bronchospasm; epilepsy; parkinsonism; interactions: Appendix 1 (parasympathomimetics)
doses: Urinary retention, 5 mg daily, half an hour before breakfast

Neurogenic bladder, 5 mg daily or on alternate days, half an
hour before breakfast
pregnancy:
Pregnancy manufacturer advises avoid (may stimulate uterine
contractions)
